event.title: moved to California later that year

data.event: He moved to California later that year in the California Gold Rush.
The community was called "Grove" when a post office was established on June 30, 1855.
On June 24, 1856 it was changed to Bedford.

event.title: was formally established as the county seat of Taylor County by a legislative act in 1853

data.event: Other histories have noted possible other sources of the name: Bedford in England (possible original home of early settlers) Bedford, Indiana (reputed home of the surveyor) Bedford, Pennsylvania (reputed home of a "government engineer") The community was formally established as the county seat of Taylor County by a legislative act in 1853.
The town was formally laid out on lots sold on July 4, 1853 (which at the time identified the community as "Bedforde").
